original_text: there is one surefire way to get a nomination for a best-foreign-film oscar : make a movie about whimsical folk who learn a nonchallenging , life-affirming lesson while walking around a foreign city with stunning architecture .
generated_text:
1. "The most predictable and cliché film about a group of tourists learning a superficial lesson while admiring the Eiffel Tower."
2. "Underwhelming experience, as the movie relies too heavily on tired tropes and fails to deliver any real depth or emotion."
3. "A shallow, overly sentimental film that mistakes beautiful scenery for substance, leaving viewers feeling unfulfilled."
4. "A disappointing and uninspired attempt at capturing the essence of a foreign city, relying on tired clichés and lacking any real depth or complexity."
